page.title: 01BUCHLYVIE LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The village of{BUCHLYVIE}lies between the town of{STIRLING}and the city of {GLASGOW}and is within easy reach of the beautiful scenic areas of the { {TROSSACHS}and{LOCH LOMOND.}The village is surrounded, in the main, by farmland, and, to a lesser extent, by {CONIFEROUS FOREST}and{PEAT BOG}to the North West. In this one small block there are thirteen farms, many of which have been run by the same families for decades. There is some historical evidence to suggest that the village of{BUCHLYVIE}was erected a {BURGH OF BARONY}as early as{1554.}The origin of the name is uncertain but it may have been derived from the Gaelic {"BOTH LARNEUCH"}which means 'House for shooting' or 'Fortified house' and there are remains of{PICTISH} or {SCANDINAVIAN FORTS}in the area.
